subject: Re: [junit] Why does BaseTestRunner require TestCase class rather than the Test interface?

Subject: Re: [junit] Why does BaseTestRunner require TestCase class rather than the Test interface?

Bruno,

On 10/10/07, Bruno Felaco <cfelaco@...> wrote:
>  So why does the code cast the Class to a TestCase?  It seems like
> this is a case of overzealous use of the new parameterized types in
> Java 5 and a regression from JUnit 3.

I'd say merely mistaken, rather than overzealous.  :-)  Submit a bug
report, and it should be easy to fix in 4.5.

> Also, in JUnit 3 the method loadSuiteClass() called getLoader() to get
> the ClassLoader to use, which opened the door for extensibility.  This
> is gone now, why?

Can't say the why.  Can you open another bug, perhaps with a test
you'd like to see compile and pass?  Thanks,

   David Saff
